details: AGNISH ADITYA  Email: agnishaditya96@gmail.com National Law University Odisha Phone: +91-8170009934 | 9439474284 E D U C A T I O N A L  Q U A L I F I C A T I O N S  6th Semester, B.B.A. L.L.B., National Law University Odisha (2014-19), CGPA: 6.63/8.    Class XII, All India Senior School Certificate Examination, DAV Model School, Durgapur (2014), Percentage (Best of 5): 92.75 %.   Class  X,  All  India  Secondary  School  Examination,  Ramakrishna  Mission  Vidyapith Deoghar (2012) CGPA: 10/10. C R E D I T  C O U R S E S    Completed Single  Credit Course  on  “International Electronic Commerce Law” by  Prof. Jane K. Winn  under  the  GIAN  initiative  at  National  Law  University  Odisha.  Obtained  „Excellent‟ Grade (90/100). I N T E R N S H I P S  CHAMBERS OF ADV. RATAN K. SING H, DELHI (FCIARB) (November 2016-December 2016)   Researched on enforceability of arbitral awards set aside at the seat.   Researched on Section 25, 8 & 34 of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.   Researched  on  the  jurisdiction  of  NCLT  post  the  commencement  of  Sick  Industrial Companies (Special Provisions) Repeal Act, 2003.   Researched on the voluntary winding up procedure under the new Companies Act, 2013.   Researched  on  various  aspects  of  Construction  Contracts  (Invocation  of  Bank  Guarantee, Abandonment/Suspension of contract, etc).   Researched on withdrawal of suits under Order XXIII, Code of Civil Procedure.   Researched  on  application  for  rejection  of  plaint  under  Order  VII  Rule  11,  Code  of  Civil Procedure. ASHIRA LAW, BENG ALURU (UNDER ADV. J AYNA KOTHARI) (May 2016 – June 2016) (4 weeks)   Drafted application for setting aside an Arbitral award under section 34 of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.   Drafted  claims  and  counter-claims  for  Domestic  Arbitration  proceedings  under construction contracts.   Conducted research and presented on “Arbitrability of Fraud in India: Comparative Analysis with the U.K.”   Drafted affidavits, legal notices and appeals with regards to various civil cases and family law matters. A C H I E V E M E N T S  MOOT COURT ACHIEVEMENTS   Quarter-Finalists, 20th All India Moot Court Competition, University Law College, Bangalore (26th to 27th February, 2016).   Adjudged 2nd Best Memorial, 13th K.K. Luthra Memorial Moot Court, 2017 available at http://kkluthramoot.org/moot/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Memorial-Marks-for-the-13th-K.K.-Luthra-Memorial-Moot-Court-2017.pdf.
